body_html:
Some notes for windows users:

  1. jvm.dll need be in PATH dirs. (As what you did for LD_LIBRARY_PATH on Linux)
    set PATH=%PATH%;%JAVA_HOME%\jre\bin\server

  2. Wildcards in CLASSPATH do not work, but if you expend all of the wildcards, it is too long to fit in an env var. You could set classpath in this way:
    hadoop classpath --jar c.jar
    set CLASSPATH=c.jar
body_text:
Some notes for windows users:


jvm.dll need be in PATH dirs. (As what you did for LD_LIBRARY_PATH on Linux)
set PATH=%PATH%;%JAVA_HOME%\jre\bin\server


Wildcards in CLASSPATH do not work, but if you expend all of the wildcards, it is too long to fit in an env var. You could set classpath in this way:
hadoop classpath --jar c.jar
set CLASSPATH=c.jar
body:
Some notes for windows users:
1. jvm.dll need be in PATH dirs. (As what you did for LD_LIBRARY_PATH on Linux)
set PATH=%PATH%;%JAVA_HOME%\jre\bin\server

2.  Wildcards in CLASSPATH do not work, but if you expend all of the wildcards, it is too long to fit in an env var. You could set classpath in this way:
hadoop classpath --jar c.jar
set CLASSPATH=c.jar
